Example trying most of the `replyr` on a Spark.

```{r setup}
library('dplyr')
library('sparklyr')
source('CheckFns.R')
```


Spark 2.0.0. example.

```{r Spark200example}
# Can't easilly override Spark version once it is up.
my_db <- sparklyr::spark_connect(version='2.0.0', 
   master = "local")
class(my_db)
my_db$spark_home
runExample(remoteCopy(my_db))
my_db <- NULL; gc() # disconnect
```
